_header: All mankind turneth in wheel and that on wonder guise
Subjects: Fortune, wheel of; mutability; translations; sermons, verse in
Bibliographic Ghosts: Cambridge UK, St John’s College F.22 (159): not in this MS.
_description: A tag in the Fasciculus morum — one long couplet translating two Latin hexameters

Bod187.Transcription:
Al man kynde ys turnyd and wentAnd Pat yn wondyr gyseFor wennys
                    hyt com aȝen hyt wenteHyt abydyth yn noyn a fyse
Bod187.Editions:
Wenzel,  Siegfried. 
             Verses in Sermons: ‘Fasciculus morum’ and Its Middle
                English Poems.
         Cambridge, MA: Medieval Academy of America, 1978: 178.

Bod410.Transcription:
Al monkyn turnyein wele and þat on wonder gyseffro when it
                    come aȝen it went to dwell on all wyse

BodLauMis213.Transcription:
Al mankynd turneþ in weel and þat oon wondere gisefor
                    wheyne hit come aȝen hit went to dwelle on al wise

BodRawC670.Transcription:
All monkyn tornth in well and þat on wonder gyseFor wethen hit
                    come aȝeyn hit wente to dwelle on all wyse
BodRawC670.Editions:
Wenzel,  Siegfried. 
             Verses in Sermons: ‘Fasciculus morum’ and Its Middle
                English Poems.
         Cambridge, MA: Medieval Academy of America, 1978: 177.

EDU82.Transcription:
All man kynde torneth to wele & þat on a wonder wyseffro
                    whom hit cometh a ȝen hit weynth to dwelle on al wyse

Lincoln44.Transcription:
Al mon kynde torne to wyl & þat on a wonder wysefor when hit
                    comþ a ȝen hit weynit do to dwel on al wyse

WorcF19.Transcription:
All mon kynne tornetgh in wele and i þat on wonder gyseffor were
                    þat comen a gayn hit went to dwelle on alle wyse
